intro: Tournefortiopsis deviana, commonly known as the slender tournefortiopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to certain regions of southern Africa, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
